question: 800 Rs. becomes 956 Rs. in 3 years at certain rate of simple interest. If the rate of interest is increased by 4%, what amount will 800 Rs. become in 3 years?
explanation:
SI = 956 - 800 = 156 Rs. 
$latex \\therefore Rate = \\frac{SI\\times 100}{Prin.\\times Time}&s=1$
$latex = \\frac{156\\times 100}{800\\times 3} = 6.5\\%\\ per\\ annum&s=1$
∴ New rate = 10.5%
$latex \\therefore SI = \\frac{PRT}{100}&s=1$
$latex = \\frac{800\\times 3\\times 10.5}{100} = 252\\ Rs.&s=1$
∴ Amount = 800 + 252 = 1052 Rs.
Hence option [D] is correct answer.
